CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 19, 1946, pg. 1, reads: "1439 'Hits' Monday - ...Plenty of Room - Terrace Village residents were slow in utilizing bus transportation owning to uncertainty of schedule. Hilltoppers decided to make sure buses would run both ways for they attempted to leave their Government Project homes.  Trolleys and buses are still running but service is slow due to inadequate number of vehicles in operation. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Woman standing beside no. 365 bus with sign reading "Terrace - 2," with another woman and girl walking away in background, at Terrace Village housing project
